books.summary: When all the humans disappear, three dogs named Max, Rocky, and Gizmo must navigate a world without their beloved owners. As they journey through the wilderness, facing dangers and meeting new animal friends, the dogs learn the true meaning of loyalty and family.

books.title: Lincoln: A Photobiography
books.summary: This book provides a captivating look at the life of Abraham Lincoln through photographs, illustrations, and insightful text. It explores his early years, political career, presidency, and the impact he had on American history.

books.title: The Voice That Challenged a Nation: Marian Anderson and the Struggle for Equal Rights
books.summary: This biography delves into the life of Marian Anderson, a trailblazing African-American singer who overcame racial barriers to become an internationally renowned artist. It highlights her struggles, triumphs, and contributions to the civil rights movement.

books.title: The War to End All Wars: World War I
books.summary: This book provides an in-depth exploration of World War I, examining the causes, battles, key figures, and lasting impact of the conflict. It offers a comprehensive overview of the war's complexities and significance.

books.title: The Wright Brothers: How They Invented the Airplane
books.summary: In this biography, readers discover the inspiring story of Orville and Wilbur Wright, the inventors of the first successful airplane. The book details their pioneering work, struggles, and ultimate triumph in revolutionizing human flight.

books.title: An Indian Winter
books.summary: Set in 1950s American West, this novel follows the journey of a young Navajo girl who defies cultural norms to pursue her passion for painting. The story explores themes of identity, heritage, and artistic expression amidst a backdrop of cultural change.

books.title: Children of the Great Depression
books.summary: This book offers a poignant look at the experiences of children during the Great Depression, highlighting their struggles, resilience, and role in shaping American society. It combines personal accounts, photographs, and historical context to paint a vivid picture of this challenging era.

books.title: Eleanor Roosevelt: A Life of Discovery
books.summary: Explore the remarkable life of Eleanor Roosevelt, a pioneering First Lady and advocate for social justice and human rights. This biography delves into her childhood, marriage to Franklin D. Roosevelt, political career, and lasting legacy.

books.title: Buffalo Hunt
books.summary: Set in the 1870s American West, this novel follows a young Lakota boy on his first buffalo hunt, a rite of passage that tests his courage and skills. The story offers insight into Lakota culture, survival skills, and the changing landscape of the American frontier.

books.title: The Boston Tea Party
books.summary: Delve into the history of the Boston Tea Party, a pivotal event in the lead-up to the American Revolution. This book details the causes, events, and consequences of the protest, shedding light on the tensions between the American colonies and British authorities.

books.title: Washington at Valley Forge
books.summary: This book provides a detailed account of George Washington's crucial winter at Valley Forge during the American Revolutionary War. It explores the hardships faced by the Continental Army, Washington's leadership, and the turning point it represented in the war.

books.title: The True Confessions of Charlotte Doyle
books.summary: This historical fiction novel follows the journey of Charlotte Doyle, a young girl who finds herself aboard a ship with a ruthless captain and a mutinous crew. Charlotte must navigate the treacherous seas, facing challenges that force her to question her beliefs and embrace her inner strength.

books.title: Crispin: The Cross of Lead
books.summary: Set in 14th century England, this novel tells the story of Crispin, a young boy accused of a crime he did not commit. Forced to flee his village, Crispin embarks on a journey of self-discovery and survival, uncovering secrets about his past along the way.

books.title: Poppy
books.summary: In this fantasy novel, Poppy, a brave mouse, sets out on a quest to save her family and friends from the sinister owl, Mr. Ocax. With courage and determination, Poppy faces danger and learns the true meaning of loyalty and sacrifice.

books.title: The Seer of Shadows
books.summary: In this gripping mystery, a young photographer named Horace discovers he has a unique ability to capture the supernatural on film. When he becomes entangled in a web of deceit and dark secrets, Horace must use his gift to uncover the truth before it's too late.

books.title: Nothing But the Truth
books.summary: This thought-provoking novel explores the consequences of a high school student's small fib spiraling out of control, leading to a national controversy. Told through a series of journal entries, interviews, and memos, the story challenges readers to consider the power of truth and the importance of integrity.

books.title: The Barn
books.summary: A group of teenagers stumbles upon an abandoned barn in the woods, unaware of the dark secrets lurking within its walls. As they uncover the chilling history of the barn and its previous inhabitants, the teens must confront their fears and unravel a mystery that threatens to consume them.

books.title: Emily Upham's Revenge
books.summary: Set during the American Revolution, this novel follows Emily Upham, a young girl determined to seek revenge on the British soldiers who have taken her father prisoner. With the help of a mysterious stranger, Emily embarks on a dangerous journey that will test her courage and resilience.

books.title: Bright Shadow
books.summary: In a magical world where shadows hold secrets and power, a young girl named Morwenna discovers she has the ability to control her shadow. But when a dark force threatens to destroy the balance of light and shadow, Morwenna must embark on a quest to save her world from darkness.

books.title: The Secret School
books.summary: During the early 1900s in a remote mining town, a determined young girl named Ida Bidson takes on the role of teacher in a secret school after the regular teacher leaves. Facing challenges from the townspeople and the school board, Ida must fight to keep the school open and her students educated.

books.title: The Man Who Was Poe
books.summary: In this intriguing mystery, young Edmund and his sister are plunged into a dangerous quest to solve the disappearance of their family and the enigmatic writer, Edgar Allan Poe. Edmund must navigate through a web of clues and suspicions to uncover the truth behind Poe's disappearance and his family's fate.

books.title: Island of the Blue Dolphins
books.summary: This classic novel tells the story of a young girl named Karana who is stranded on an island off the coast of California. As she learns to survive on her own, she also forms a powerful connection with the natural world around her.

books.title: Sing Down the Moon
books.summary: Set in the 1860s, this novel follows the journey of a Navajo girl named Bright Morning who is captured by Spanish slavers. She must find a way to escape and return to her home, facing challenges along the way.

books.title: The Black Pearl
books.summary: This thrilling story follows a young boy named Ramon who sets out to capture the legendary black pearl from a giant manta ray. His quest takes him on a dangerous adventure filled with suspense and excitement.

books.title: The King's Fifth
books.summary: In this novel, a young mapmaker named Esteban is caught up in the search for gold in the New World. As he navigates the treacherous landscape of colonial Mexico, he grapples with questions of loyalty and greed.

books.title: Sarah Bishop
books.summary: Set during the American Revolution, this novel follows the story of a young girl named Sarah Bishop who must fend for herself in the wilderness after her family is forced to flee their home. Her resilience and courage are put to the test as she faces numerous challenges.

books.title: The Road to Damietta
books.summary: This novel tells the story of Saint Francis of Assisi's journey to Egypt during the Fifth Crusade. Through his encounters with people of different faiths and backgrounds, Francis learns valuable lessons about tolerance and understanding.

books.title: Catherine, Called Birdy
books.summary: Narrated in the form of a diary, this novel follows the misadventures of a spirited girl named Catherine who is determined to avoid an arranged marriage. Her humorous and relatable voice brings medieval England to life.

books.title: Zia
books.summary: Set in California during the 19th century, this novel follows the journey of a young Native American girl named Zia who is searching for her missing brother. Along the way, she encounters challenges that test her strength and resilience.

books.title: Streams to the River, River to the Sea
books.summary: This novel retells the story of Lewis and Clark's famous expedition through the eyes of Sacagawea, a young Shoshone woman who played a crucial role in the journey. It explores themes of courage, friendship, and cultural exchange.

books.title: The Captive
books.summary: In this novel, a young girl named Miriam is abducted by the Seneca tribe during the French and Indian War. As she struggles to adapt to her new life, she forms unexpected bonds with her captors and learns valuable lessons about survival and empathy.

books.title: Bridge to Terabithia
books.summary: Bridge to Terabithia follows the friendship between Jess Aarons and Leslie Burke as they create an imaginary kingdom in the woods. Together, they face personal challenges and learn about loss and resilience.

books.title: Jacob Have I Loved
books.summary: Jacob Have I Loved tells the story of Sara Louise Bradshaw, a twin overshadowed by her sister Caroline. The novel explores themes of jealousy, sibling rivalry, and finding one's own identity.

books.title: The Great Gilly Hopkins
books.summary: The Great Gilly Hopkins follows the story of an 11-year-old foster child, Gilly, who is determined to find her birth mother. Through her journey, Gilly learns about acceptance and family.

books.title: Lyddie
books.summary: Lyddie narrates the story of a young girl in the 19th century who works in a textile mill to pay off family debts. The novel explores themes of perseverance, labor rights, and independence.

books.title: The Day of the Pelican
books.summary: The Day of the Pelican follows the journey of a 12-year-old Muslim girl, Meli, who flees from war-torn Kosovo to America. The novel highlights themes of resilience, cultural identity, and adapting to a new home.

books.title: Jip: His Story
books.summary: Jip: His Story tells the tale of an orphan, Jip, who lives in a poorhouse in Vermont and seeks to uncover his true identity. The novel delves into themes of belonging, friendship, and self-discovery.

books.title: The Same Stuff as Stars
books.summary: The Same Stuff as Stars follows the story of Angel, a young girl who lives in a dysfunctional family. Angel's life takes a turn when she meets a woman who helps her discover hope and strength within herself.

books.title: The Master Puppeteer
books.summary: The Master Puppeteer is set in 18th-century Japan and follows the journey of a young apprentice in the world of puppet theater. The novel explores themes of tradition, family, and the art of storytelling.

books.title: Preacher's Boy
books.summary: Preacher's Boy tells the story of Robbie Hewitt, the son of a preacher, who grapples with faith and doubt in a small New Hampshire town. The novel examines themes of family, community, and personal beliefs.

books.title: Come Sing, Jimmy Jo
books.summary: Come Sing, Jimmy Jo centers around a young boy named Jimmy Jo who dreams of becoming a country music star. The novel explores themes of family dynamics, dreams, and the power of music.

books.title: Swindle
books.summary: After a valuable baseball card is swindled away from him, Griffin Bing and his friends form a plan to steal it back. Along the way, they uncover a web of deceit and adventure that will put their friendship to the test.

books.title: Ungifted
books.summary: When an accidentally enrolled prankster ends up at a school for gifted students, chaos ensues as he tries to blend in and navigate the world of high IQ students. Will he be able to keep his secret under wraps?

books.title: Restart
books.summary: After suffering from amnesia due to a fall off a roof, Chase wakes up a completely different person. As he navigates his new life, he must confront his past actions and their consequences.

books.title: The Unteachables
books.summary: A group of misfits end up in the classroom of a teacher who has given up on teaching. Through their quirky personalities and camaraderie, they learn that there's more to education than just grades.

books.title: Masterminds
books.summary: In a town where everything seems too perfect, a group of kids discover a dark secret that shatters their reality. They must band together to uncover the truth and escape the lies they've been living.

books.title: Pop
books.summary: A young boy unexpectedly becomes a pop star overnight, thrusting him into a world of fame and fortune. As he navigates this new reality, he learns the true meaning of friendship and identity.

books.title: No More Dead Dogs
books.summary: When a student is banned from reading his favorite book in English class, he sets out to rewrite the story in a way that will satisfy his teacher. Hilarity ensues as he delves into the world of storytelling.

books.title: Slacker
books.summary: Cameron Boxer is the king of slackers until an elaborate scheme to earn money to fund his video game habit goes awry. Forced to confront his laziness, Cameron must step up and take on responsibilities.

books.title: Everest
books.summary: A group of teens embarks on a treacherous journey to climb Mount Everest. As they face extreme challenges and dangers, they must rely on each other and their strength to survive the world's highest peak.

books.title: Jailbait
books.summary: When a high school student is wrongly accused of a crime, he must navigate the system and prove his innocence. With the help of his friends, he sets out to unravel the mystery and clear his name.

books.title: Make Lemonade
books.summary: Make Lemonade is a novel about 14-year-old LaVaughn who takes on a babysitting job to earn money for college. She ends up forming a unique bond with Jolly, a single mother of two, and learns valuable life lessons about perseverance, determination, and the true meaning of friendship.

books.title: True Believer
books.summary: True Believer follows 17-year-old LaVaughn as she faces new challenges and decisions about her future. As she struggles with family issues, friendships, and budding romance, LaVaughn must navigate the complexities of growing up and staying true to herself.

books.title: This Full House
books.summary: This Full House is a poignant novel that explores the themes of family, loss, love, and acceptance. Through the eyes of LaVaughn, readers delve into the emotional journey of coping with grief and finding hope in unexpected places.

books.title: Bat 6
books.summary: Bat 6 is a powerful story set in the 1940s, focusing on the rivalry between two girls' softball teams from different communities. As tensions rise and secrets unravel, the girls must confront the impact of prejudice, war, and the meaning of friendship.

books.title: The Mozart Season
books.summary: The Mozart Season follows the journey of 12-year-old Allegra as she prepares to compete in a prestigious young musicians' competition. As Allegra navigates the challenges of perfectionism, family dynamics, and self-discovery, she learns valuable lessons about passion, dedication, and the true joy of music.

books.title: Probably Still Nick Swansen
books.summary: Probably Still Nick Swansen is a touching novel that delves into the life of 15-year-old Nick Swansen, who struggles with his identity, family relationships, and the challenges of adolescence. Through humor and heart, Nick embarks on a journey of self-discovery and acceptance.

books.title: The Watcher
books.summary: The Watcher is a compelling novel that explores the themes of friendship, trust, and discovering one's voice. When 13-year-old Parker witnesses a crime in her neighborhood, she must grapple with fear, loyalty, and the weight of keeping secrets.

books.title: Mozart Season
books.summary: Mozart Season is a heartwarming novel that follows the journey of Allegra, a young violinist preparing for a music competition. Through her dedication, passion, and challenges, Allegra learns the true value of perseverance, family support, and the joy of making music.

books.title: Bold Freedom: The Story of the Bear Who Brought Words
books.summary: Bold Freedom tells the inspiring tale of a bear who learns to speak and uses his newfound words to bring change and understanding to his forest community. Through courage, compassion, and unity, the bear shows the power of communication and the strength of standing up for what is right.

books.title: The First Time She Drowned
books.summary: The First Time She Drowned is a gripping novel that follows the story of Cassie, a young woman who struggles to come to terms with her past and the trauma inflicted by her mother. Through resilience, self-discovery, and facing her fears, Cassie learns to find her own voice and reclaim her life.

books.title: Sabriel
books.summary: Sabriel follows a young necromancer, also named Sabriel, as she embarks on a journey to find her missing father and bring him back from death. Set in a world of magic and mystery, Sabriel must navigate dangerous realms to fulfill her destiny and confront the forces of darkness.

books.title: Lirael
books.summary: Lirael is a companion novel to Sabriel and follows a young woman discovering her own powers as a Clayr, a seer with the ability to see into the future. As she sets out on a quest to find her purpose, Lirael uncovers ancient secrets that could change the fate of her world.

books.title: Abhorsen
books.summary: In the final book of the Old Kingdom trilogy, Abhorsen, the necromancer Sabriel returns to face her greatest challenge yet. With the fate of the realm hanging in the balance, Sabriel must confront the powerful evil known as the Destroyer and prevent it from unleashing chaos and destruction.

books.title: Shade's Children
books.summary: Shade's Children is a dark and gripping tale set in a post-apocalyptic world where children are raised to be soldiers and are never allowed to grow up. When a group of young rebels discovers a way to fight back against their oppressors, they must risk everything to reclaim their future.

books.title: The Seventh Tower Series
books.summary: The Seventh Tower series follows a young boy named Tal as he navigates a treacherous tower filled with elemental magic and sinister plots. Tal must unlock his own latent powers and uncover the mysteries of the towers to save his family and his people from a looming darkness.

books.title: The Keys to the Kingdom Series
books.summary: The Keys to the Kingdom series follows a boy named Arthur as he discovers a hidden realm parallel to our own, filled with strange and dangerous creatures. Tasked with finding the Seven Keys to save the world from destruction, Arthur must outwit enemies and unlock ancient secrets to fulfill his destiny.

books.title: Frogkisser!
books.summary: Frogkisser! is a whimsical and adventurous tale about a princess named Anya who sets out on a quest to break a curse that turned her prince into a frog. Along the way, Anya encounters talking dogs, mischievous wizards, and magical creatures as she learns what it truly means to be a hero.

books.title: Angel Mage
books.summary: Angel Mage is a captivating fantasy novel inspired by The Three Musketeers, where Liliath, an angel mage, seeks to reunite with her lost love through powerful magic. As she forms alliances and faces adversaries, Liliath must navigate a world of intrigue and danger to achieve her ultimate goal.

books.title: Newt's Emerald
books.summary: Newt's Emerald is a delightful blend of Regency romance and magical adventure, following Lady Truthful Newington as she goes on a quest to recover her stolen family heirloom, Newt's Emerald. Disguised as a man, Truthful encounters dashing rogues and dangerous enchantments in her pursuit of justice and love.

books.title: Have Sword, Will Travel
books.summary: Have Sword, Will Travel is a humorous and action-packed novel about two unlikely heroes, Odo and Eleanor, who stumble upon a magical sword that binds them together in a quest to save the kingdom. Along the way, Odo and Eleanor must overcome their differences and discover their own bravery to confront a powerful enemy.

books.title: Every Soul a Star
books.summary: Three very different teenagers are brought together by a solar event at the Moon Shadow Campground and Observatory, and their lives are forever changed as they learn more about themselves and the universe around them.

books.title: 11 Birthdays
books.summary: Amanda and Leo have celebrated their birthdays together since they were born, until a big fight ruined their 10th birthday. However, they are given a chance to relive the day and make things right in this charming story about friendship and second chances.

books.title: A Mango-Shaped Space
books.summary: Thirteen-year-old Mia has synesthesia, a condition where she sees colors when she hears sounds or reads words. This unique ability sets her apart but also helps her navigate through the challenges of middle school and understanding herself.

books.title: Jeremy Fink and the Meaning of Life
books.summary: Jeremy Fink receives a mysterious wooden box with four locks on his 13th birthday, and an accompanying note says it contains the meaning of life. Along with his best friend Lizzy, Jeremy embarks on a quest to find the keys to unlock the box and discover its secrets.

books.title: The Candymakers
books.summary: Four kids with different backgrounds enter a candy-making contest held by the Life is Sweet candy company. As the competition progresses, secrets are revealed, friendships are tested, and the contestants must navigate through twists and turns to uncover the truth behind the candy-making process.

books.title: A Mango-Shaped Space
books.summary: Thirteen-year-old Mia has synesthesia, a condition where she sees colors when she hears sounds or reads words. This unique ability sets her apart but also helps her navigate through the challenges of middle school and understanding herself.

books.title: Pisces
books.summary: Tara has always felt a deep connection to the water and a sense of being out of place on land. When she discovers she can breathe underwater and communicate with sea creatures, she begins to unravel the mystery of her origins and her destiny as a water elemental.

books.title: The Last Present
books.summary: Amanda and Leo return for another adventure in which they must unravel the mystery of a magical box that grants wishes but also brings unforeseen consequences. With the help of their friends, they navigate through time loops and challenges to set things right.

books.title: Twice Upon a Time
books.summary: Jonah and his sister Katherine are summoned to help the future King Arthur escape a curse by time-traveling to the past. Along the way, they encounter various characters from fairy tales and must navigate through challenges to rewrite Arthur's fate.

books.title: The Bridge to Terabithia
books.summary: Jess and Leslie become unlikely friends and create an imaginary kingdom called Terabithia, where they rule as king and queen. Together, they face bullies, confront their fears, and learn important lessons about friendship, loss, and the power of imagination.

books.title: The Outsiders
books.summary: The Outsiders follows the rivalry between two groups, the working-class 'Greasers' and the wealthier 'Socs.' Ponyboy Curtis, a Greaser, narrates the story as he navigates through friendship, loyalty, and societal pressures. The novel explores themes of class conflict, identity, and the importance of empathy.

books.title: Rumble Fish
books.summary: Rumble Fish delves into themes of alienation, rebellion, and the complexities of brotherly relationships. The story follows Rusty-James, a teenager trying to navigate his life in a rough and tumble world filled with gang violence and familial struggles. The novel explores the search for identity and the consequences of risky behavior.

books.title: Tex
books.summary: Tex is a coming-of-age story that follows the journey of a teenage boy named Tex, who is trying to make sense of his dysfunctional family and his place in the world. The novel explores themes of family dynamics, responsibility, and self-discovery as Tex navigates through adolescence and learns valuable life lessons.

books.title: That Was Then, This Is Now
books.summary: That Was Then, This Is Now is a young adult novel that explores the complexities of friendship and the consequences of choices. The story follows the bond between two best friends, Bryon and Mark, as they navigate through the challenges of growing up in a tough neighborhood. The novel delves into themes of loyalty, morality, and the painful realities of facing the consequences of one's actions.

books.title: Hawkes Harbor
books.summary: Hawkes Harbor is a dark and haunting tale that follows the life of a man named Jamie Sommers who finds himself in a mysterious and sinister mental asylum. The novel weaves together elements of mystery, romance, and the supernatural as Jamie navigates through his past and the secrets of Hawkes Harbor. The story explores themes of redemption, resilience, and the power of human connection.

books.title: Taming the Star Runner
books.summary: Taming the Star Runner follows the story of Travis, a troubled teenager who is sent to live on a ranch as a form of rehabilitation. As Travis navigates through his personal struggles and confronts his past, he forms unexpected connections with the people around him and discovers his passion for writing. The novel explores themes of self-discovery, second chances, and the transformative power of creativity.

books.title: Big David, Little David
books.summary: Big David, Little David is a heartwarming children's story about the bond between two brothers, one big and one little. The book follows their everyday adventures, mishaps, and moments of laughter as they navigate through the ups and downs of brotherhood. With charming illustrations and simple language, the story celebrates the joy of sibling relationships and the importance of love and friendship.

books.title: The Puppy Sister
books.summary: The Puppy Sister is a delightful children's tale that follows the adventures of a young boy named Dennis who wishes for a puppy but ends up with a mischievous puppy sister instead. The story explores themes of family dynamics, responsibility, and the unconditional love between siblings. With humor and heartwarming moments, the book celebrates the joys and challenges of having a new addition to the family.

books.title: Some of Tim's Stories
books.summary: Some of Tim's Stories is a collection of charming and whimsical short stories that follow the adventures of a boy named Tim and his imaginative escapades. From encountering magical creatures to solving mysteries, each story is filled with humor, wonder, and life lessons. With enchanting illustrations and engaging storytelling, the book sparks creativity and celebrates the joys of childhood imagination.

books.title: Charlie Sleeps In
books.summary: Charlie Sleeps In is a delightful children's book that tells the story of Charlie, a bear who loves to sleep in while his friends are busy starting their day. The book follows Charlie's cozy and humorous adventures as he embraces his unique habit and finds joy in his own way of living. With adorable illustrations and a heartwarming tale, the book celebrates the importance of self-acceptance and individuality.

books.title: Inkheart
books.summary: In this magical fantasy novel, a young girl named Meggie discovers that her father has the ability to bring characters from books to life when a mysterious stranger named Dustfinger appears in their world. As the boundaries between reality and fiction blur, Meggie and her father must navigate a dangerous adventure filled with literary characters and dark forces.

books.title: The Thief Lord
books.summary: Set in Venice, this captivating adventure follows a group of orphans led by the mysterious Thief Lord. When they steal a valuable object that holds a powerful secret, they find themselves caught up in a thrilling chase through the streets and canals of the city, facing danger and betrayal at every turn.

books.title: Dragon Rider
books.summary: In this enchanting fantasy tale, a young dragon named Firedrake sets out on a quest to find a legendary safe haven for dragons. With the help of a human boy named Ben, they face perilous challenges and encounter magical creatures on their journey, learning the true meaning of friendship and bravery.

books.title: Reckless
books.summary: In this dark and thrilling fantasy series, Jacob Reckless discovers a mysterious mirror world hidden behind his father's study. As he delves deeper into this dangerous realm filled with hidden dangers and ancient curses, Jacob must confront his own past and make difficult choices to protect his loved ones.

books.title: Ghost Knight
books.summary: When Jon Whitcroft is sent to boarding school in a spooky ancient castle, he is plagued by ghostly apparitions until he meets a ghostly knight named Sir William. Together, they uncover dark secrets from the past and embark on a thrilling adventure to rid the castle of evil spirits and solve a haunting mystery.

books.title: Inkspell
books.summary: In this captivating sequel to Inkheart, Meggie and her family are drawn back into the world of books and face new challenges as the boundaries between reality and fiction continue to blur. With old and new characters at play, they must navigate a complex web of magic and danger to survive.

books.title: The Wild Chicks
books.summary: Four girls form a close-knit friendship group known as 'The Wild Chicks' and navigate the ups and downs of adolescence together. Through their adventures and challenges, they learn about friendship, loyalty, and the power of staying true to themselves in a changing world.

books.title: Igraine the Brave
books.summary: Igraine, a young girl from a family of magicians, dreams of becoming a knight. When her parents accidentally turn themselves into pigs, Igraine must embark on a daring quest to save them and prove her bravery. Along the way, she discovers her own courage and cleverness, facing magical creatures and challenges.

books.title: Fearless
books.summary: Jacob Reckless returns in this thrilling fantasy sequel as he navigates a perilous journey to find a powerful magical crossbow that could change the fate of the Mirrorworld. With dark forces at work and unexpected allies by his side, Jacob must confront his own fears and make sacrifices to protect those he loves.

books.title: When Santa Fell to Earth
books.summary: On Christmas Eve, young Ben finds Santa Claus crash-landed on his roof after his sleigh is shot down by an evil sorcerer. Together with a group of magical creatures, they must save Christmas and defeat the sorcerer in a heartwarming and humorous holiday adventure that celebrates the spirit of the season.

books.title: Al Capone Does My Shirts
books.summary: Set in 1935, Moose Flanagan moves with his family to Alcatraz Island where his father works as a prison guard. Moose's life is turned upside down as he navigates growing up, making new friends, and dealing with the challenges of living on the notorious island.

books.title: Notes from a Liar and Her Dog
books.summary: Antonia is struggling with family issues and a compulsive lying habit. With the help of her dog Pistachio, she learns to confront her past, embrace the truth, and build stronger relationships with those around her.

books.title: No Passengers Beyond This Point
books.summary: Three siblings find themselves on a mysterious journey after their parents decide to move the family to a strange new house in a new town. As they navigate their new reality, they must rely on each other to overcome challenges and uncover the truth about their situation.

books.title: Moonstruck: The True Story of the Cow Who Jumped Over the Moon
books.summary: A humorous and imaginative retelling of the classic nursery rhyme, exploring the escapades of the adventurous cow who dreams of jumping over the moon. The story is filled with whimsical illustrations and delightful rhymes.

books.title: How to Make Friends with a Ghost
books.summary: This charming and funny book offers tips and advice on how to befriend a ghost, with heartwarming and silly scenarios that demonstrate the true meaning of friendship. Perfect for young readers who enjoy a spooky but delightful tale.

books.title: Chasing Secrets
books.summary: Set in 1900s San Francisco during a plague outbreak, 13-year-old Lizzie Kennedy sets out to solve a mystery involving her friends, family secrets, and a race against time to find a cure. The story is filled with suspense, intrigue, and historical details.

books.title: If a Tree Falls at Lunch Period
books.summary: Two teenagers from different backgrounds—Kirsten and Walk—are thrown together in an unlikely friendship as they navigate the challenges of family issues, school drama, and personal growth. Their bond becomes a source of strength and understanding as they face their own struggles and learn important life lessons.

books.title: Putting the Monkeys to Bed
books.summary: A collection of playful and imaginative poems that explore the whimsical world of bedtime rituals. From brushing teeth to tucking in stuffed animals, each poem captures the joy and comfort of getting ready for a good night's sleep.

books.title: Al Capone Shines My Shoes
books.summary: The sequel to 'Al Capone Does My Shirts,' Moose Flanagan faces new challenges and unexpected consequences when a mysterious note from Al Capone himself leads to a series of events that test his courage, loyalty, and determination.

books.title: No Passengers Beyond This Point
books.summary: Three siblings find themselves on a mysterious adventure after their parents decide to move the family to a strange new town. As they discover hidden talents, face magical creatures, and unravel family secrets, they must work together to find their way home.

books.title: Sister Wife
books.summary: In 'Sister Wife', a teenage girl navigates complex family dynamics when her father introduces a new wife into their polygamous household. The protagonist grapples with her identity, relationships, and independence in the face of cultural and societal expectations.

books.title: Dancing Naked
books.summary: 'Dancing Naked' follows the journey of a high school student as she battles an eating disorder and struggles with body image issues. The novel delves into themes of self-acceptance, mental health, and the importance of seeking help.

books.title: Lost in Time
books.summary: In 'Lost in Time', a group of teenagers discovers a time machine and embarks on a thrilling adventure through different historical eras. As they navigate the complexities of altering the past, the characters face moral dilemmas and learn valuable lessons about the consequences of their actions.

books.title: The Truth Trap
books.summary: 'The Truth Trap' follows a young detective duo as they investigate a series of mysterious occurrences in their town. Filled with twists, turns, and suspense, the novel engages readers in solving the puzzle alongside the protagonists.

books.title: Moon Time
books.summary: 'Moon Time' takes readers on a magical journey to a realm where the moon holds extraordinary powers. When a young protagonist discovers her own connection to the moon, she must navigate challenges and quests to unlock her true potential.

books.title: Slice
books.summary: 'Slice' tells the story of a teenage girl who dreams of becoming a competitive swimmer while dealing with family secrets and personal struggles. Through perseverance and self-discovery, the protagonist learns valuable lessons about resilience and determination.

books.title: Blue Flame
books.summary: 'Blue Flame' transports readers to the tumultuous backdrop of the French Revolution, where a young woman finds herself caught in a web of intrigue, romance, and political upheaval. The novel explores themes of loyalty, betrayal, and the fight for freedom.

books.title: Why Can't I Be You
books.summary: 'Why Can't I Be You' follows the tumultuous friendship between two teenage girls who navigate jealousy, identity struggles, and the complexities of adolescence. The novel delves into themes of self-discovery and the impact of societal expectations on friendship dynamics.

books.title: Vicious
books.summary: 'Vicious' is a heart-pounding thriller that follows a group of friends as they uncover dark secrets within their seemingly idyllic town. As they unravel a sinister plot, the characters must confront their fears and fight to protect themselves and their community.

books.title: Death Notices
books.summary: 'Death Notices' follows a young protagonist who possesses the ability to foresee death through the appearance of mysterious notices. As the protagonist grapples with this supernatural gift, they uncover a web of secrets and conspiracies that put their own life at risk.

books.title: Out of the Dust
books.summary: Set during the Great Depression, 'Out of the Dust' tells the story of Billie Joe, a young girl in Oklahoma who struggles to find hope and happiness amidst the dust storms and hardships of the era. Through poetry, Billie Joe reflects on her losses and triumphs, ultimately finding the strength to rebuild her life.

books.title: Aleutian Sparrow
books.summary: In 'Aleutian Sparrow', Hesse explores the little-known history of the Aleutian Islands and the internment of the Aleut people during World War II. The novel follows the journey of a young Aleut girl named Vera as she navigates the challenges of war, loss, and resilience.

books.title: Letters from Rifka
books.summary: 'Letters from Rifka' follows the story of Rifka, a young Jewish girl fleeing Russia with her family in the early 1900s. Through a series of letters to her cousin, Rifka recounts her journey across Europe and eventually to America, highlighting the struggles and triumphs of immigrants during that time.

books.title: Phoenix Rising
books.summary: In 'Phoenix Rising', Hesse explores the aftermath of a nuclear disaster in a small Vermont town. The novel follows Nyle, a young girl who befriends a survivor of the disaster, as they both come to terms with loss, healing, and the possibility of new beginnings.

books.title: The Music of Dolphins
books.summary: In 'The Music of Dolphins', Hesse tells the story of Mila, a girl who was raised by dolphins after being lost at sea as a young child. When she is discovered and reintegrated into human society, Mila must reconcile her two worlds and find her own identity.

books.title: Brooklyn Bridge
books.summary: Set in New York City during the 1900s, 'Brooklyn Bridge' follows the story of a young boy named Joseph, who dreams of building a bridge that will connect Brooklyn and Manhattan. Through Joseph's determination and creativity, the novel celebrates the power of dreams and perseverance.

books.title: Stowaway
books.summary: 'Stowaway' tells the captivating tale of Nicholas, a young boy who sneaks aboard Captain Cook's ship, the Endeavour, and embarks on a thrilling journey around the world. As Nicholas encounters new lands and cultures, he discovers the price of adventure and the value of friendship.

books.title: Witness
books.summary: Set in 1924, 'Witness' tells the story of Leanora Sutter, a black girl in a small Vermont town who becomes the target of racial prejudice and violence. Through the perspectives of multiple characters, the novel explores themes of injustice, community, and the power of standing up for what is right.

books.title: Wish on a Unicorn
books.summary: In 'Wish on a Unicorn', Hesse weaves a magical tale of friendship and adventure as two siblings, Charlie and Thiele, discover a magical unicorn in the woods behind their new home. As they embark on a quest to help the unicorn return to its realm, the siblings learn valuable lessons about courage and compassion.

books.title: Come On, Rain
books.summary: 'Come On, Rain' is a beautifully illustrated picture book that celebrates the joy of a summer rainstorm in an urban neighborhood. Through the eyes of a young girl named Tess, readers experience the sights, sounds, and smells of the rain as it transforms the city and brings new life to the community.

books.title: The Basic Eight
books.summary: A darkly humorous novel following Flannery, a high school student who becomes involved in a scandalous murder, exploring themes of teenage angst and peer pressure.

books.title: Adverbs
books.summary: A collection of interconnected short stories exploring different types of love, with each story titled as different adverbs, offering a unique perspective on relationships.

books.title: Watch Your Mouth
books.summary: A satirical novel blending Yiddish folklore with modern-day family drama, focusing on a graduate student uncovering a scandalous family secret while exploring themes of heritage and identity.

books.title: We Are Pirates
books.summary: A novel following the misadventures of a teenage girl and her dysfunctional family as they embark on a modern-day pirate adventure, exploring themes of rebellion and family dynamics.

books.title: Why We Broke Up
books.summary: A novel told through a series of letters from a teenage girl to her ex-boyfriend, detailing the reasons for their breakup and reflecting on the complexities of teenage relationships.

books.title: All The Dirty Parts
books.summary: A provocative novel exploring teenage sexuality through the perspective of a high school boy, delving into the raw and unfiltered aspects of adolescent desires and experiences.

books.title: The Composer is Dead
books.summary: A whimsical picture book combining mystery and music, as a detective interrogates various musical instruments to solve the murder of the composer, offering a fun introduction to the orchestra.

books.title: Goldfish Ghost
books.summary: A heartwarming picture book following the ghost of a goldfish as it searches for a friend, encountering various sea creatures and exploring themes of loneliness and companionship.

books.title: Bottle Grove
books.summary: A darkly comic novel weaving together the lives of two couples in San Francisco, exploring themes of love, loss, and ambition against the backdrop of the city's changing landscape.

books.title: The Basic Eight
books.summary: A darkly humorous novel following Flannery, a high school student who becomes involved in a scandalous murder, exploring themes of teenage angst and peer pressure.
